author: Rachel Paige
title: Hereâ€™s why everyone on Twitter is crying over ducks â€” go ahead and blame â€œThis Is Usâ€
text:
Hereâ€™s why everyone on Twitter is crying over ducks â€” go ahead and blame â€œThis Is Usâ€ The latest episode of This Is Us , â€œMemphis,â€ is one weâ€™ve been preparing for since the very beginning. But, now that weâ€™re here, turns out we still werenâ€™t prepared for it. Spoilers â€” AND TEARS â€” ahead, obviously.
If youâ€™ve been waiting all season for a father-son road trip, it happened during â€œMemphis.â€ Though Randall is still recovering from his nervous breakdown , and Williamâ€™s health is very quickly deteriorating, the two decide to take a trip together to Memphis. Itâ€™s where William grew up, and he wants to show Randall where heâ€™s from (and maybe meet a few relatives along the way).
Go grab some tissues now. Do it.
So, off William and Randall go to Memphis (along the way stop at Jackâ€™s gravesite, I TOLD YOU TO GET TISSUES). As they drive, William mentions that he wants to take Randall to the Peabody Hotel in Memphis to see the ducks there â€” and FYI, the Peabody has ducks that play in the fountain in the lobby every day, and itâ€™s kind of a big deal, because ducks are awesome.
Anyway. Since you could just feel going into this episode, with the father-son trip to see Williamâ€™s past life, things were quickly going to take a turn for the worst. While William makes amends with his cousin, and plays one last gig, the next day his health begins failing at a rapid pace and heâ€™s admitted to the hospital. He dies in Randallâ€™s arms, and stop for a sec to take another tissue break.
Itâ€™s all the more heartbreaking when you realize that William never got the chance to take Randall to see the ducks, and Randall canâ€™t help but cry, â€œwe havenâ€™t even seen the ducks!â€ 
"We haven't even seen the ducks, man." - Randall's flawless (and totally legit) reasoning against death. #ThisIsUs 
â€” cjoanporter (@cjoanporter) February 22, 2017 Cut to the end of the episode, when Randall starts driving home with the windows down (William told him to roll the windows down). As heâ€™s driving, his car comes to a stop so he can let a family of ducks cross in front of him.
RANDALL GOT TO SEE THE DUCKS. If you were keeping it together, and holding back your sniffles, thereâ€™s a high chance you let the waterworks flow as soon as those ducks started crossing. Twitter erupted into nothing short of duck-chaos.
THE DUCKS MAN THE DUCKS #ThisIsUs
